author: Manuela Herreros
title: Huelva sufre los efectos de la DANA y contin\u00faa en alerta roja por tormentas
text: La DANA no ha terminado y ha tenido en jaque esta noche a la provincia de Huelva, donde se mantiene aún la alerta roja por fuertes lluvias en la capital y en zonas del litoral por parte de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AMET).. Aunque ya ha pasado lo peor, aún habrá que mantener todas las precauciones durante toda la jornada de hoy porque la alerta roja se mantiene hasta las 12.00 horas en el litoral de Huelva, mientras que en las comarcas de Aracena, Andévalo y Condado el aviso es naranja por lluvias y amarillo por tormentas.. Asimismo, desde la Diputación de Huelva han informado que la provincia se encuentra amenazada "por lluvias torrenciales", por lo que, ante esta situación, han destacado que "es obligado extremar las precauciones", no salir de casa y no usar el vehículo.. La institución provincial ha señalado que municipios como Aljaraque ha registrado 150 litros por metro cuadrado, así como que "circunstancias similares" se dan en Cartaya con 170 litros, Gibraleón y Punta Umbría.. Por su parte, desde el Ayuntamiento de Huelva han subrayado la capital ha vivido una noche de fuertes lluvias en la que los servicios de emergencias, en coordinación con Policía Local y bomberos, "han respondido perfectamente a las incidencias", y no hay que lamentar daños personales, y los materiales son "muy localizados". En total se han atendido más de 80 incidencias, la mayoría por anegaciones de locales y viviendas.. En este punto, el Consistorio ha apuntado que los trabajos preventivos en la ciudad han sido "clave" para evitar "efectos mayores", al tiempo que ha indicado que se mantiene activo el Plan de Emergencia Municipal en su nivel 1, y ha pedido "respetar las recomendaciones de seguridad y evitar toda salida innecesaria durante el resto de la jornada".

author: Press Trust of India
title: ISRO's Big Defence Boost For India - 50 Spy Satellites In 5 Years. Details Here
text: ISRO plans to launch 50 satellites for intelligence gathering in 5 years. (Representational) India is aiming to launch 50 satellites in the next five years for geo-intelligence gathering which will include the creation of a layer of satellites in different orbits with a capacity to track the movement of troops and image thousands of kilometers of area, Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) chairman S Somanath said on Thursday. For realising India's aspiration to become a strong nation, the current size of its satellite fleet is not enough and it should be "ten times what we have today", he said, speaking at 'Techfest', an annual science and technology event organised by the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay. Defence intelligence gathering satellites are popularly called 'spy-sats', short for spy satellites. Mr Somanath further said that it was important to improve the ability of satellites to detect changes, to bring in more of AI-related and data-driven approach to analyse data, reduce data downloads and get only the necessary information. Spacecrafts are capable of observing a country's borders and neighbouring regions, the ISRO chief noted. "All of it can be seen from satellites. This capability gives us enormous potential. We have been launching satellites to handle this, but there is a different way of thinking now and we need to look at it in a much more critical manner because the power of (any) nation is the ability to understand what is happening around it," Mr Somanath said. Many satellites are being designed and configured, he said. "We have already configured 50 satellites to be realised in the next five years and this is going to be launched for India for supporting this particular geo-intelligence capability over the next five years plus (period)," the ISRO chief added. If India is able to launch satellites at this scale, threats to the country can be better mitigated, Mr Somanath said. "We have found out a way by which a layer of satellites can be launched starting from GEO (geostationary equatorial orbit) to LEO (lower earth orbit) and also (in) very low earth orbit where we need very critical assessment of some situation," he said. This is a new domain which is coming up not only in optical, but also in SAR (synthetic aperture radar), thermal and various other technologies, Mr Somanath pointed out. "We will have communication between satellites, so that if some satellite detects something, which is at GEO at 36,000 kms, it can have a large view. If you find some activity happening, you can task another satellite in the lower orbit (to check) much more carefully and then give more information," he said. "We are also looking at imaging, not a very small area (but) thousands of kilometers of area and we would like to cover entire borders in everyday cycles. This is a tremendous capability that we are building if we are able to launch these satellites in the next five years," he said. Promoted Listen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com Mr Somanath noted that the overall satellite fleet of the country, with its current strength of 54, is "just not enough" for a nation like India which is aspiring to be powerful and strong. "I think it must be ten times what we have today," the ISRO chief said.

author: La Opinión de A Coruña
title: El tiempo en Negreira: previsión meteorológica para hoy, viernes 29 de diciembre - La Opinión de A Coruña
text: Hoy en Negreira, se espera un día con cielos mayormente cubiertos y lluvias escasas. Según los datos proporcionados, el estado del cielo estará variando a lo largo del día, comenzando con un cielo cubierto con lluvia escasa en la madrugada y la mañana. A medida que avance el día, se espera que el cielo se despeje gradualmente, pasando a estar poco nuboso y con nubes altas en la tarde. Las temperaturas se mantendrán bastante estables a lo largo del día, con valores que oscilarán entre los 9°C y los 13°C. La sensación térmica será similar a la temperatura real, por lo que no se esperan cambios significativos en cuanto a la sensación de frío o calor. La humedad relativa se mantendrá elevada durante la madrugada y la mañana, con valores que rondarán entre el 81% y el 87%. A medida que avance el día, la humedad irá disminuyendo, llegando a valores de alrededor del 66% en la tarde y la noche. En cuanto al viento, se espera que sople de dirección variable, predominando principalmente del oeste y noroeste, con velocidades que oscilarán entre los 1 km/h y los 7 km/h. No se esperan ráfagas de viento significativas. En cuanto a las precipitaciones, se espera que sean escasas a lo largo del día, con valores de alrededor de 0.1 mm en la madrugada y la mañana. A partir de la tarde, no se esperan precipitaciones significativas, por lo que es probable que el resto del día se mantenga seco. En resumen, para hoy en Negreira se espera un día mayormente cubierto con lluvias escasas en la madrugada y la mañana. A medida que avance el día, el cielo se irá despejando gradualmente, pasando a estar poco nuboso y con nubes altas en la tarde. Las temperaturas se mantendrán estables, con valores que oscilarán entre los 9°C y los 13°C. La humedad relativa será elevada durante la madrugada y la mañana, disminuyendo a lo largo del día. El viento soplará de dirección variable, predominando del oeste y noroeste, con velocidades suaves. No se esperan precipitaciones significativas a partir de la tarde. Información elaborada utilizando, entre otras, la obtenida de la [Agencia Estatal de Meteorología. © AEMET](http://www.aemet.es/). Fecha de actualización de los datos: 2023-12-28T22:43:56

author: Anthony France
title: Israeli military ‘regrets harm’ after more than 100 killed in refugee camp strikes
text:
[Anthony France](/author/anthony-france) @NewsFrenchTony2 minutes ago [Israel](/topic/israel) has said it “regrets the harm” caused by airstrikes that killed dozens of civilians earlier this week.
About 131 people died when the Maghazi and Bureij refugee camps, east of Deir al-Balah, were pounded late on Sunday, according to figures by the United Nation’s human rights office.
An Israel Defense Forces spokesman told the KAN public broadcaster on Thursday: “The type of munition did not match the nature of the attack, causing extensive collateral damage that could have been avoided.”
In a later statement, the IDF said: “A preliminary investigation revealed that additional buildings located near the targets were also hit during the strikes, which likely caused unintended harm to additional uninvolved civilians.”
The IDF said it “regretted the harm” to non-combatants in the incident, saying that the strike had targeted
[Hamas](/topic/hamas) operatives.
On Tuesday, Israeli forces expanded their ground offensive into urban refugee camps in central
[Gaza](/topic/gaza) after bombarding crowded [Palestinian](/topic/palestinian) communities and ordering residents to evacuate.
Despite
[US](/topic/us) calls for Israel to curb civilian casualties and international pressure for a ceasefire, Israeli Prime Minister [Benjamin Netanyahu](/topic/benjamin-netanyahu) said the military was deepening the fighting in retaliation for Hamas gunmen’s murderous assault on October 7.
Israel blames Hamas for the high civilian death toll in Gaza, citing militants’ use of crowded residential areas and tunnels.
Officials say they killed thousands of the enemy, without presenting evidence.
Israel’s offensive is one of the most devastating military campaigns in recent history.
More than 20,900 Palestinians, two-thirds women and children, have been killed, according to the Health Ministry in Gaza, whose count doesn’t differentiate between civilians and combatants. The agency said 240 people were killed over the past 24 hours.
The UN human rights office said the continued bombardment of middle Gaza had claimed more than 100 Palestinian lives since Christmas Eve. The office noted that Israel had ordered some residents to move there.

author: TMZ Staff
title: Illinois Star Terrence Shannon Jr. Found Not Guilty Of Rape
text: Illinois Star Terrence Shannon Jr. Not Guilty Of Rape, Sexual Battery Illinois basketball star Terrence Shannon Jr. has been found not guilty in his rape trial ... with the NBA prospect being acquitted of all charges on Thursday. The decision was announced minutes ago ... with the jury coming to its conclusion after just over an hour of deliberation. Shannon Jr. was accused of sexual misconduct following a trip to Lawrence, Kansas in September ... and was suspended from the Illinois basketball team after being charged with rape and sexual battery . The punishment was later overturned in court ... allowing him to return to the team after missing six games. The potential draft pick maintained his innocence from the very beginning ... turning himself in shortly after the charges were filed and cooperating with authorities throughout the investigation. Shannon Jr. was emotional as the verdict was read ... hugging his legal team and loved ones in court. Emotions in Kansas court as the verdict is read NOT GUILTY for former— Bret Beherns (@WCIA3Bret) [#Illini]Terrence Shannon Jr. The immediate reaction from his legal team, family and friends in Lawrence [pic.twitter.com/bL1bhAGYQ0] [June 13, 2024] [@WCIA3Bret] The Douglas County District Attorney’s office released a statement on the news ... saying, "It takes tremendous courage for a survivor of sexual assault to come forward. We will continue to pursue justice on behalf of survivors." With the trial behind him, Shannon Jr. -- who averaged 23 points in his senior season -- can now put his focus on the draft in two weeks.

author: Safak Costu
title: From Prison to Support: New Haven Couple Opens Transitional Home for Re-Entrants
text:
In a heartwarming twist of fate, Ray Boyd and Jackie James, a couple deeply rooted in New Haven's Hill neighborhood, are setting a remarkable example of community empowerment and rehabilitation. Drawing from personal trials and tribulations, the duo is in the process of converting James' childhood residence into a beacon of hope for formerly incarcerated individuals striving to reintegrate into society. This initiative, stemming from their newly established nonprofit, Next Level Empowerment Program, aims to furnish a supportive environment for up to seven men at a time, facilitating their transition with counseling, resources, and a sense of belonging.
A Personal Mission Turned Community Vision
Boyd's release from prison in early 2021, after a 30-year sentence, marked the beginning of a challenging yet transformative journey. Coupled with James' professional background in social work, their combined experiences laid the groundwork for Next Level Empowerment Program. The vision for the transitional home is not merely about providing shelter but also about extending pre and post-release support to individuals and their families, thereby fostering holistic rehabilitation and reducing recidivism. The couple's initiative is significantly backed by local funding, including a substantial grant earmarked for the renovation of the house, alongside community contributions and potential fundraising endeavors.
Building Beyond Brick and Mortar
The significance of Boyd and James' project transcends the physical transformation of the property; it symbolizes a profound commitment to healing and growth. By naming the house after the late Vincent A. Moore, a mentor and advocate for justice, they honor the legacy of those who have paved the way for reform and support within the correctional system. The planned collaboration with the T.R.U.E. unit at Cheshire Correctional Institution underscores a strategic approach to re-entry, ensuring that the transition begins from within the prison walls and continues seamlessly into the community.
Envisioning a Future of Empowerment and Inclusion
Looking ahead, Boyd and James aspire to expand their reach, dreaming of establishing additional transitional housing for both men and women, and initiating vocational training programs. Their ambitious plans reflect a broader mission to break the cycle of incarceration and empower individuals to rebuild their lives with dignity and support. Through their warm line service and personal dedication, the couple is already making a tangible impact, offering guidance, empathy, and a listening ear to those in need. As they move forward, their efforts symbolize a profound belief in second chances and the power of community to enact meaningful change.
In a world where the path from incarceration back to community integration is fraught with challenges, Boyd and James' initiative shines as a beacon of hope and transformation. Their work not only exemplifies personal resilience but also represents a collective step towards a more compassionate and supportive society. As the ribbon-cutting ceremony approaches, the Hill neighborhood and beyond watch with anticipation, ready to witness the unfolding of a new chapter in community empowerment and rehabilitation.
